title: I Wrote a Song
body:
It's so easy for any chump to doodle on MS paint and upload it, but it's hard as fuck to share a song.

I wrote a (metal) song I call "The Howling Abyss" (as I'm an ARAM only player), but I don't have recording/mixing gear, or a PC good enough to do that well.
I can only play one instrument at a time (not layered guitars, bass, drums, etc), as I only have two arms.

I'd like to share it, is anyone on the boards from Dunedin (NZ) and have recording/mixing gear?

replies.body: I mean even with just a decent-ish mic and Audacity (free) you can do a pretty good job of both audio cleanup and mixing. Naturally it's going to be a lot more tedious in a free and more generalised program that it would be with proper gear and software, but it's doable. Even if you only used it to experiment it's still a start right?

I have a decent mic, but my PC is a toaster. Like 10 years old, no GFX card toaster. I play LoL on minimum settings at 15-20 fps.
I had a decent PC but it died, I spend all money on music gear.

[edit] I can't even input my studio mic into my toaster PC

What are your specs? I recently upgraded. Might be able to send you my old parts.

They're not the best - but not total shit. It'll run LoL at 60 fps at medium settings.

My specs are: complete toaster.
10+ year old office PC with no GPU and maybe 2GB RAM tops.
I used to have a better PC, but it died, this was the cheapest thing I could find.
Old parts won't fit, this is a fucking Dell optiplex 755, about as trash as a working PC can get, yet I still get S grades in LoL, lmao. 15-20fps (at min settings) can't stop me!
You're some sort of fucking god, getting S's with that.

I am just a man.
Ah, I had forgotten that little snag. Well I guess if you're really keen, a few hundred dollars for a new pc is the next thing to save up for, or, as you say borrowing from someone :P

I knew this Korean dude that had a studio setup in his house (and lived near me), but my connection to him was the Mormon church, which I was only into because I wanted to learn what they were about, not what I actually believe in. I totally had the Mormon's  coming round each week for an hour, giving me lessons, just because I knew nothing about them. I don't disrespect them at all, I went to church with them and it was a great experience, but I'm a scientist/Buddhist at heart.

I can't corrupt my beliefs for a studio recording for an online game, that would be shallow as fuck.
